faq_section_1.question: What do I need to prepare to rent a car?

answer.intro: To register for a car rental, you only need a credit or debit card.
answer.at_counter: When at the rental counter, you will need:
list: Credit card of the main driver (some rental companies also accept debit cards, but most won't).
answer.important: Important: Make sure you also check the rental terms, as each car rental company will have its own rules. For example: They may need to see additional identification. They may not accept certain types of credit cards. Or they may not rent if the driver has had a license for less than 36 months.

faq_section_1.question: Am I old enough to rent a car?
faq_section_1.answer: Most companies will let you rent a car if you are 21 years old or older (and some will rent to younger drivers). But if you are under 25, you may still have to pay a 'young driver surcharge'.

faq_section_2.question: Can I book a car for my partner, friends, etc.?
faq_section_2.answer: Of course. Just fill in their information in the 'Driver Details' form when you book.

faq_section_2.question: What should I consider when choosing a car?

list: Consider where you're going. An Exciter might be a great choice for cruising through the Hai Van Pass, but a smaller car might be more sensible for driving in Rome.
See what others say. You'll find plenty of reviews and ratings on our website. So find out what other customers liked (and didn't like) about each rental company.
Don't forget to consider the transmission. In some countries, almost everyone drives manual. In others, automatic is the standard. Make sure you rent a car you can drive!

paragraphs: The price you see includes the car, mandatory insurance (e.g., Theft Protection, Collision Damage Waiver) and fees, if any, typically paid at pickup (e.g., one-way fee, airport surcharge, or local taxes).
The price also includes any additional services you've added (e.g., GPS device or child seat).
The price does not include any additional insurance you purchase at the rental counter.
